items.question: I work alone — is Lako for me?
items.answer: Yes, Lako is built specifically for solo entrepreneurs who drive themselves and need fast documentation in the field.

items.question: Can I use it from my phone, on the road?
items.answer: Yes, everything works through Telegram — create documents right from the loading or unloading site, no computer needed.

items.question: What about the SEF portal?
items.answer: The bot generates an XML file in UBL 2.1 format. You just upload it to efaktura.gov.rs — no manual entry required.

items.question: I don't have a dispatcher — do I get all features?
items.answer: Yes, you have access to all modules — trips, CMR, invoices, e-invoices, statistics. No dispatcher needed.

items.question: How long does onboarding take?
items.answer: The entire process takes 1 day. Sign up, enter your company details — and start working. All instructions are on our website.

items.question: Do drivers need smartphones?
items.answer: Yes, any Android or iPhone with Telegram. Most drivers already have a phone.

items.question: Does Lako work with ERP systems?
items.answer: Lako works as a standalone system and does not require ERP integration (PANTHEON, SAP, etc.). Documents are generated independently.

items.question: How much does it cost?
items.answer: Solo entrepreneurs: 1,490 RSD/month. Companies: 3,500 RSD/month. First 5 clients: 3 months free. Everyone else: 30-day free trial, no obligations.

items.question: Can I try before buying?
items.answer: Yes — we offer a 30-day trial with no obligations.

items.question: Is my data safe?
items.answer: Yes. Data is stored on secure servers in Europe and is accessible only to you. We never share it with third parties. If you cancel, you get 30 days to export all data (trips, invoices, customers in Excel), after which it is permanently deleted.

items.question: How is my data technically protected?
items.answer: All data is encrypted in transit (HTTPS/TLS) and at rest (PostgreSQL with encryption). Automatic backups are made every 24 hours and stored for 30 days. Server access is restricted to authorized personnel only.

items.question: Who can see my data?
items.answer: Only you and employees you add to the system yourself. Technical support can access your data ONLY with your permission to resolve issues. All support actions are logged.

items.question: What if the server goes down?
items.answer: We have a recovery plan: automatic backups every 24 hours, system restoration within 2-4 hours, and a Telegram notification about the issue. Also, all your PDF documents (CMR, invoices) and Excel exports are always with you — you don't depend on the server alone.

trips.title: Trip Management
trips.description: Complete guide for creating, searching and managing trips through the Telegram bot.

steps.title: Creating a trip
steps.content: Open Main menu → New trip. Select a vehicle, then a driver. Enter the pickup city and address, delivery city and address, then select a client. Finally, enter the cargo description, weight, and price. Alternatively, use Quick trip which requires only 4 steps.
steps.tip: Quick trip is ideal for repeating routes — enter only the key data.

steps.title: Trip list
steps.content: View all trips with a status filter (created, in progress, completed, cancelled). The list shows 10 trips per page with pagination.

steps.title: Search
steps.content: Use search to quickly find a trip — search by number, client, city, or driver.

steps.title: Trip statuses
steps.content: Each trip goes through phases: Created → In Progress → Completed. A trip can also be cancelled. You can change the status from the trip card.
steps.tip: A driver with a linked Telegram account can change the status of their own trips — with photo and GPS evidence submission.

steps.title: Editing a trip
steps.content: Open the trip card and edit any field — city, address, cargo, price, driver, vehicle, or client. Editing is available while the trip status is Created or In Progress.

steps.title: Duplicating a trip
steps.content: Create a copy of an existing trip for a similar route — save time on repeat deliveries.

steps.title: Templates
steps.content: Save a trip as a template for your most common routes. Create a new trip from a template in one click.
steps.tip: Templates are ideal for regular lines — e.g. Belgrade–Novi Sad every Monday.

steps.title: Export to Excel
steps.content: Export all trips or filtered by status to an .xlsx file. Available on the Early Adopter and PRO plans.

cmr.title: CMR Documents
cmr.description: Guide for generating CMR consignment notes from the Telegram bot.

steps.title: When to generate a CMR
steps.content: Open the card of a completed trip and click the CMR button. The CMR is generated based on the trip data — addresses, cargo, driver, vehicle.
steps.tip: You can generate a CMR for trips that are not yet completed, but it is recommended to enter all data beforehand.

steps.title: CMR wizard
steps.content: Fill in additional fields: packaging type, quantity, markings, goods description, and notes. These fields are optional but enrich the document.

steps.title: Auto-numbering
steps.content: Each CMR receives a unique number in the format CMR-YYYY-NNN, unique to your company.

steps.title: PDF document
steps.content: The CMR is generated as a professional PDF with Latin font (Roboto), ready for printing on A4.

steps.title: Download
steps.content: The PDF is sent as a file directly in the Telegram chat — download it with one click.

invoices.title: Invoices
invoices.description: Guide for creating professional invoices with all required data.

steps.title: Creating an invoice
steps.content: Open the trip card and click the Invoice button. The invoice is created with the trip data — client, services, price.

steps.title: Invoice wizard
steps.content: Enter the invoice number (auto or manual), issue date, payment term (7, 15, or 30 days), and line items — each with description, quantity, unit, price, and VAT.

steps.title: Service templates
steps.content: Use ready-made service templates (Transport service, Loading, Unloading, etc.) to quickly add line items to the invoice.
steps.tip: Templates save time — add your most common services in one click.

steps.title: Invoice statuses
steps.content: An invoice is created with the status Sent. The status can then be changed to: Paid or Cancelled. Change the status from the invoice card.

steps.title: Invoice list
steps.content: View all invoices with a status filter. Each invoice is linked to the trip it was created from.

steps.title: PDF document
steps.content: The invoice is generated as a professional PDF with company details, line items, VAT, and total amount.

efaktura.title: E-Invoices (XML)
efaktura.description: Guide for generating XML e-invoices for the efaktura.gov.rs (SEF) portal.

steps.title: What is an e-invoice
steps.content: An e-invoice is an XML file in UBL 2.1 format that is uploaded to the efaktura.gov.rs (SEF) portal for electronic invoicing in Serbia.

steps.title: Generation
steps.content: Open the trip card that has an invoice and click the E-invoice button. The XML is generated based on the invoice data.

steps.title: Validation
steps.content: Before generating, the bot checks if the company and client have a tax ID (PIB) entered and if the invoice has line items. If something is missing — you will get an error message.
steps.tip: Make sure to enter the tax ID for your company and clients before generating e-invoices.

steps.title: XML file
steps.content: The XML file is downloaded from Telegram and manually uploaded to the SEF portal.

steps.title: E-invoice statuses
steps.content: The bot generates the XML file with status Generated. Further statuses (Sent, Accepted, Rejected) are tracked on the SEF portal.

drivers.title: Driver Management
drivers.description: Complete guide for managing drivers — from adding to linking with Telegram.

steps.title: Opening the Drivers section
steps.content: In the main menu, click the 👤 Drivers button to open the list of all drivers in your company.

steps.title: Adding a driver
steps.content: Click ➕ Add → enter first name, last name, phone number, driver's license number, and notes (optional).

steps.title: Linking a Telegram account
steps.content: When you add a driver, the bot automatically generates a personal invite link. Click '📤 Share link' to send the link to the driver. The driver clicks the link → the bot automatically recognizes and links them to their account. The owner receives a notification of successful linking.
steps.tip: Each driver gets a unique link — no manual linking needed. The link can be regenerated in the driver's card.

steps.title: What the driver sees
steps.content: A linked driver sees their own trip list, can change statuses (created → in progress → completed), submit photo evidence and GPS location on status changes, and download CMR and invoices.

steps.title: Editing a driver
steps.content: Select the driver from the list → open the card → Edit → change name, last name, phone, license number, or notes.

steps.title: Unlinking Telegram
steps.content: In the driver card, click 'Unlink Telegram' — the driver loses access to the bot and can no longer see trips.

steps.title: Deleting a driver
steps.content: Click Delete → confirm. Deletion is a soft-delete — the driver's trips are preserved in the history.
steps.tip: Even if you delete a driver, all their trips remain saved in the system.

vehicles.title: Vehicle Management
vehicles.description: Guide for managing your fleet — adding, editing, and tracking vehicles.

steps.title: Adding a vehicle
steps.content: Enter the license plate, make, model, type (Truck, Van, or Trailer), load capacity, and notes.

steps.title: Vehicle list
steps.content: View all vehicles sorted by license plate.

steps.title: Editing a vehicle
steps.content: Open the vehicle card and edit the plate, make, model, capacity, technical inspection date, or notes.

steps.title: Deleting a vehicle
steps.content: Click Delete → confirm.

steps.title: Inspection reminders
steps.content: The bot automatically notifies you when a technical inspection date is approaching for your vehicle.
steps.tip: Enter the exact technical inspection date to receive timely reminders.

customers.title: Customer Database
customers.description: Guide for managing your customer database — adding, searching, and editing.

steps.title: Adding a customer
steps.content: Enter the company name, tax ID (PIB), address, city, contact person, and phone.

steps.title: Customer list
steps.content: View all customers sorted by name with city displayed.

steps.title: Editing a customer
steps.content: Open the customer card and edit any field.

stats.title: Statistics & Excel
stats.description: Guide for tracking performance and exporting data.

steps.title: Dashboard
steps.content: See an overview of trips by status, total revenue, invoice totals, top client, top vehicle, and top driver.

steps.title: Period

steps.title: Driver statistics

steps.title: Client statistics
steps.content: View the number of trips and total revenue for each client.

steps.title: Overdue invoices

seoBlock.title: Digitizing road transport in Serbia
seoBlock.text: Road transport in Serbia faces increasingly strict legal requirements — from mandatory waybills for every goods shipment to electronic invoicing through the Electronic Invoice System (SEF). Solo entrepreneurs and small transport companies often waste time on manual paperwork instead of focusing on driving and delivery. Lako Prevoz Bot automates this process: from creating waybills and CMR consignment notes to generating XML e-invoices for the SEF portal — all through Telegram, right from the field. Serbian transport law requires every shipment to have accompanying documentation, and Lako ensures you always have it at hand.

whatAreCookies.content: Cookies are small text files stored on your device when you visit a website. They are used to remember your preferences and improve your browsing experience.

cookiesWeUse.title: Cookies We Use
cookiesWeUse.content:
We use the following types of cookies:
- Essential cookies: storing cookie consent preference (cookie-consent)
- Analytics cookies: Cloudflare Web Analytics for anonymous visit tracking (no personal data)

thirdParty.title: Third-Party Cookies
thirdParty.content: Cloudflare may use cookies to protect the website from malicious traffic. These cookies are essential for the website to function properly.

manageCookies.title: Managing Cookies
manageCookies.content: You can manage cookies through the banner on our website or your browser settings. Please note that blocking some cookies may affect website functionality.

cookies.essentialNote: These cookies are essential for the website to function and cannot be disabled.

trustBanner.question: Is my data safe?
trustBanner.subtitle: Your invoices and business data are protected at every step — from encryption to server security.

items.question: Is e-Faktura Studio free?
items.answer: Yes, the basic plan is free forever — 3 invoices per month with full functionality.

items.question: Does the generated XML match the SEF format?
items.answer: Yes, we generate UBL 2.1 XML fully compatible with Serbia's Electronic Invoice System (SEF).

items.question: Can I use it without registration?
items.answer: Yes! Without an account, you can generate up to 3 invoices per month. Your company data is stored locally in the browser.

items.question: What data is needed for an invoice?
items.answer: PIB and name of seller and buyer, addresses, items with prices and VAT rates. The system automatically calculates totals.

items.question: Do you support flat-rate taxpayers?
items.answer: Yes! If you're not in the VAT system, the system automatically generates an invoice with VAT exemption.

items.question: Is my data secure?
items.answer: Passwords are stored with argon2 encryption. All communication is over HTTPS. We don't share data with third parties.
